description.narrative: Country Accelerator Lab for enabling testing, innovations/experiment and rapid delivery;

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
OUTPUT INDICATORS 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies
3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative:
1.1. 2 new sources of data per year 1.2. 3 different type of data sources per year 1.3. 20 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4. 2 innovation methods per Action Plan
2.1. 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2. At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3. At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods.
3.1. The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year 3.2. 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3. The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4. Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

1.1. 2 new sources of data per year - Reasons for low LPG uptake - List of local innovations and solutions - Geographical data on erosion
1.2. 3 different type of data sources per year - Geospatial data - Open-data - Surveys - Direct interview - Focus Groups - Socioeconomic data
1.3. 20 new potential solutions per lab per year - -
1.4. 2 innovation methods per Action Plan - Collective Intelligence - Sensemaking - Solutions mapping
2.1. 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. - 2 blogs published in December 2021: - Looking beyond income: Excessive risk aversion may hinder the uptake of LPG among low-income households. - Using a community-based approach to map erosion sites in the city of Pemba - One press release on the Accelerator Lab launch.
2.2. At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. - 2 out of 3 main projects/activities have public sector counterpart. -The lab is working with the Ministry of Science and Technology, and Higher Education to design and deploy a Nation Innovation Platform. - The lab is working with the Pemba Municipality in Mapping Erosion and studying its causes in the Pemba municipality.
2.3. At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. - The lab has proposed and is coordinating a solutions mapping strategy with the Ministry of Science which gave them the opportunity to learn about the methodology. - The lab has also held a series of talks with different partners from the innovation ecosystem including incubators, and innovator associations.
2.4. At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. - All three main projects provide actionable knowledge to projects on livelihoods, energy, disaster resilience, and local solutions.
3.1. The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year - The lab participates on weekly global drop-in calls. - The team participates on biweekly calls for their specific roles (explorers, solution mappers, experimenters). - The portuguese speaking countries (PALOPS) in the network have set up a collaboration groups that meet monthly. - The lab collaborated with UNDP Malawi Accelerator Lab to jointly submit proposal for African Borders Challenge.
3.2. 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. - blogs published in December.
3.3. The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. - The lab was featured in two occasions during the year.
3.4. Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem. - Team has identified and interacted with Idea Lab which is a major player in the local innovation/development ecosystem. - The lab linked up with UNICEF local office through social media and submitted a joint proposal for Green Shark Tank Challenge

3.1. The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year - The lab members participated in bootcamp that introduced procedures and methodologies used by the Accelerator Lab - The lab participated on weekly global drop-in calls
